column2: THOUGHT AND PURPOSE
column3: THOUGHT AND PURPOSE

column2: UNTIL thought is linked with purpose there is no intelligent accomplishment.
column3: UNTIL thought is linked with purpose there is no intelligent accomplishment.

column2: With the majority the bark of thought is allowed to "drift" upon the ocean of life.
column3: With the majority the bark of thought is allowed to "drift" upon the ocean of life.

column2: Aimlessness is a vice, and such drifting must not continue for him who would steer clear of catastrophe and destruction.
column3: Aimlessness is a vice, and such drifting must not continue for him who would steer clear of catastrophe and destruction.

column2: They who have no central purpose in their life fall an easy prey to petty worries, fears, troubles, and self-pityings, all of which are indications of weakness, which lead, just as surely as deliberately planned sins (though by a different route), to failure, unhappiness, and loss, for weakness cannot persist in a power evolving universe.
column3: They who have no central purpose in their life fall an easy prey to petty worries, fears, troubles, and self pityings, all of which are indications of weakness, which lead, just as surely as deliberately planned sins (though by a different route), to failure, unhappiness, and loss, for weakness cannot persist in a power evolving universe.

column2: A man should conceive of a legitimate purpose in his heart, and set out to accomplish it.
column3: A man should conceive of a legitimate purpose in his heart, and set out to accomplish it.

column2: He should make this purpose the centralizing point of his thoughts.
column3: He should make this purpose the centralizing point of his thoughts.

column2: It may take the form of a spiritual ideal, or it may be a worldly object, according to his nature at the time being; but whichever it is, he should steadily focus his thought-forces upon the object, which he has set before him.
column3: It may take the form of a spiritual ideal, or it may be a worldly object, according to his nature at the time being; but whichever it is, he should steadily focus his thought forces upon the object, which he has set before him.

column2: He should make this purpose his supreme duty, and should devote himself to its attainment, not allowing his thoughts to wander away into ephemeral fancies, longings, and imaginings.
column3: He should make this purpose his supreme duty, and should devote himself to its attainment, not allowing his thoughts to wander away into ephemeral fancies, longings, and imaginings.

column2: This is the royal road to self-control and true concentration of thought.
column3: This is the royal road to self control and true concentration of thought.

column2: Even if he fails again and again to accomplish his purpose (as he necessarily must until weakness is overcome), the _strength of character gained_ will be the measure of _his true_ success, and this will form a new starting-point for future power and triumph.
column3: Even if he fails again and again to accomplish his purpose (as he necessarily must until weakness is overcome), the underscore strength of character gained underscore will be the measure of underscore his true underscore success, and this will form a new starting point for future power and triumph.

column2: Those who are not prepared for the apprehension of a _great_ purpose should fix the thoughts upon the faultless performance of their duty, no matter how insignificant their task may appear.
column3: Those who are not prepared for the apprehension of a underscore great underscore purpose should fix the thoughts upon the faultless performance of their duty, no matter how insignificant their task may appear.

column2: Only in this way can the thoughts be gathered and focussed, and resolution and energy be developed, which being done, there is nothing which may not be accomplished.
column3: Only in this way can the thoughts be gathered and focussed, and resolution and energy be developed, which being done, there is nothing which may not be accomplished.

column2: The weakest soul, knowing its own weakness, and believing this truth _that strength can only be developed by effort and practice,_ will, thus believing, at once begin to exert itself, and, adding effort to effort, patience to patience, and strength to strength, will never cease to develop, and will at last grow divinely strong.
column3: The weakest soul, knowing its own weakness, and believing this truth underscore that strength can only be developed by effort and practice,underscore will, thus believing, at once begin to exert itself, and, adding effort to effort, patience to patience, and strength to strength, will never cease to develop, and will at last grow divinely strong.

column2: As the physically weak man can make himself strong by careful and patient training, so the man of weak thoughts can make them strong by exercising himself in right thinking.
column3: As the physically weak man can make himself strong by careful and patient training, so the man of weak thoughts can make them strong by exercising himself in right thinking.

column2: To put away aimlessness and weakness, and to begin to think with purpose, is to enter the ranks of those strong ones who only recognize failure as one of the pathways to attainment; who make all conditions serve them, and who think strongly, attempt fearlessly, and accomplish masterfully.
column3: To put away aimlessness and weakness, and to begin to think with purpose, is to enter the ranks of those strong ones who only recognize failure as one of the pathways to attainment; who make all conditions serve them, and who think strongly, attempt fearlessly, and accomplish masterfully.

column2: Having conceived of his purpose, a man should mentally mark out a _straight_ pathway to its achievement, looking neither to the right nor the left.
column3: Having conceived of his purpose, a man should mentally mark out a underscore straight underscore pathway to its achievement, looking neither to the right nor the left.

column2: Doubts and fears should be rigorously excluded; they are disintegrating elements, which break up the straight line of effort, rendering it crooked, ineffectual, useless.
column3: Doubts and fears should be rigorously excluded; they are disintegrating elements, which break up the straight line of effort, rendering it crooked, ineffectual, useless.

column2: Thoughts of doubt and fear never accomplished anything, and never can.
column3: Thoughts of doubt and fear never accomplished anything, and never can.

column2: They always lead to failure.
column3: They always lead to failure.

column2: Purpose, energy, power to do, and all strong thoughts cease when doubt and fear creep in.
column3: Purpose, energy, power to do, and all strong thoughts cease when doubt and fear creep in.

column2: The will to do springs from the knowledge that we _can_ do.
column3: The will to do springs from the knowledge that we underscore can underscore do.

column2: Doubt and fear are the great enemies of knowledge, and he who encourages them, who does not slay them, thwarts himself at every step.
column3: Doubt and fear are the great enemies of knowledge, and he who encourages them, who does not slay them, thwarts himself at every step.

column2: He who has conquered doubt and fear has conquered failure.
column3: He who has conquered doubt and fear has conquered failure.

column2: His every thought is allied with power, and all difficulties are bravely met and wisely overcome.
column3: His every thought is allied with power, and all difficulties are bravely met and wisely overcome.

column2: His purposes are seasonably planted, and they bloom and bring forth fruit, which does not fall prematurely to the ground.
column3: His purposes are seasonably planted, and they bloom and bring forth fruit, which does not fall prematurely to the ground.

column2: Thought allied fearlessly to purpose becomes creative force: he who _knows_ this is ready to become something higher and stronger than a mere bundle of wavering thoughts and fluctuating sensations; he who _does_ this has become the conscious and intelligent wielder of his mental powers.
column3: Thought allied fearlessly to purpose becomes creative force: he who underscore knows underscore this is ready to become something higher and stronger than a mere bundle of wavering thoughts and fluctuating sensations; he who underscore does underscore this has become the conscious and intelligent wielder of his mental powers.

column2: THE THOUGHT-FACTOR IN ACHIEVEMENT
column3: THE THOUGHT FACTOR IN ACHIEVEMENT

column2: ALL that a man achieves and all that he fails to achieve is the direct result of his own thoughts.
column3: ALL that a man achieves and all that he fails to achieve is the direct result of his own thoughts.

column2: In a justly ordered universe, where loss of equipoise would mean total destruction, individual responsibility must be absolute.
column3: In a justly ordered universe, where loss of equipoise would mean total destruction, individual responsibility must be absolute.

column2: A man's weakness and strength, purity and impurity, are his own, and not another man's; they are brought about by himself, and not by another; and they can only be altered by himself, never by another.
column3: A man's weakness and strength, purity and impurity, are his own, and not another man's; they are brought about by himself, and not by another; and they can only be altered by himself, never by another.

column2: His condition is also his own, and not another man's.
column3: His condition is also his own, and not another man's.

column2: His suffering and his happiness are evolved from within.
column3: His suffering and his happiness are evolved from within.

column2: As he thinks, so he is; as he continues to think, so he remains.
column3: As he thinks, so he is; as he continues to think, so he remains.
